task.title: Starting the car when cold
task.shortdesc: In cold weather, or when the engine is cold, use the choke to help you turn the engine over and start the car. Let the engine warm up before you start driving.

step.cmd: Put the gear lever in neutral position.

step.stepresult: The crankshaft will rotate and after a couple of seconds the engine will start.

step.cmd: Run the engine at approximately 1,000 rpm, corresponding to a speed of 14 mph (23 kph) in top gear for several minutes.
step.stepresult: The engine will quickly attain correct working temperature.Don't attempt to warm up the engine by allowing it to idle slowly because this leads to excessive cylinder wear.
